I don't understand why this is a major problem -- If we are to remove type safety which is what it was before,  I think it makes sense to justify the decision with some sort of benchmarks to analyze worse case.

Perhaps you or <@898563924440543283> can give worse case numbers so that benchmarks can be taken with the different ways to convert to the appropriate type; copy, type casting, slice to array pointer etc?

Not entirely against the decision but with audit coming to an end, I don't want to make any changes if it does not yield any reasonable benefits
